answers.answer: Flutters and butterflies sounds right.  I had my first one at 12 weeks, when I sat in a way (with my foot up on the desk) that pressed my waistband against my side.  Maybe there is something in your posture or the pressure of your waistband that would make the flutters apparent as early as just over 10 weeks.  I have never heard that this means twins, however.

Thank you for your feed back i have an appointment with my doctor in a few moments i will mention it to her. Km fairly heavy as well but since my last app at 6 weeks ive lost 15 pounds good for me but bad for the baby? What do you think? Thought you were suspose to have some gain weight by 10 wks?

If you're heavy, it's good for you and good for the baby, to lose weight.  You don't want to suffer from high blood pressure later on, or gestational diabetes either.  Lots of heavier gals lose during pregnancy.

question: Im pregnant with my forst and im just over 10 wks. I keep getting fludders in my stomach and butterflys. Does this mean my baby is moving ? Is it impossible for this to happen at 10wks? I also read online thay it could mean twins with earily movement. Is there any truth to this?
title: wondering?
